cards.flavor: Run wyld.

cards.text: The first time each turn you trash a card you are accessing, gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: René "Loup" Arcemont: Party Animal

cards.flavor: They can buy off union leadership, but they can't stop us walking out!
cards.stripped_text: Resolve 1 of the following of the Corp's choice: * Gain 6 credits. * Draw 4 cards.
cards.text:
Resolve 1 of the following of the Corp's choice:
  • Gain 6[credit].
  • Draw 4 cards.
cards.title: Wildcat Strike

cards.flavor:
"It hungers to sink teeth into problems."
—Loup
cards.stripped_text: +1 mu Access -> Trash 2 cards from your grip: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.text: +1[mu] Access → Trash 2 cards from your grip: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Carnivore

cards.flavor: Was it something you ate?

cards.text: Install only on a piece of ice. When you install this program and when your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on this program. Hosted virus counter: Break 1 subroutine on host ice.
cards.title: Botulus

cards.flavor: Destruction is an art.
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 3 credits: +1 strength.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 3[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Buzzsaw

cards.flavor: Subtlety is a luxury.
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2 credits: +1 strength.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cleaver

cards.flavor:
"There's a tension to a cook. Each processing cycle sweetens the pot and raises the heat. I stir all night, but few have my appetite for danger."
—René "Loup" Arcemont
cards.stripped_text: When you install this program and when your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on this program. click, trash: Gain 2 credits for each hosted virus counter.
cards.text:
When you install this program and when your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on this program.
[click], [trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each hosted virus counter.
cards.title: Fermenter

cards.flavor: The greediest bloodsucker this side of a corporate boardroom.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on this program. Hosted virus counter: The ice you are encountering gets -1 strength for the remainder of this encounter.
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on this program. Hosted virus counter: The ice you are encountering gets -1 strength for the remainder of this encounter.
cards.title: Leech

cards.flavor:
"It waits on an unlabelled memstrip far below the deepest hab. Angry, desperate souls seek it out, hungry for power to change a brutal world. Once they can stomach no more bitter revenge, they return to that nameless tunnel, the book a recipe thicker."
—Heinlein urban legend
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you install a virus program, you may place 1 virus counter on it.
cards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, you may place 1 virus counter on it.
cards.title: Cookbook

cards.flavor: I obtain your desire.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, you may gain 1 credit for each time you accessed a card during that run. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, you may gain 1[credit] for each time you accessed a card during that run. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.title: Zahya Sadeghi: Versatile Smuggler

cards.flavor: The real reward is the friends you make along the way.
cards.stripped_text: Search your stack for 1 icebreaker program and reveal it. (Shuffle your stack after searching it.) If you made a successful run this turn, you may install it. If you do not, add it to your grip.
cards.text: Search your stack for 1 icebreaker program and reveal it. (Shuffle your stack after searching it.) If you made a successful run this turn, you may install it. If you do not, add it to your grip.
cards.title: Mutual Favor

cards.flavor:
"A mirrorfiber mod or high-end mantle can be helpful, but nothing beats a good dose of 'keeping your damn head down.'"
—"G0ph3r" O'Ryan
cards.stripped_text: Run any server. During that run, the rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 3 credits.
cards.text: Run any server. During that run, the rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 3[credit].
cards.title: Tread Lightly

cards.flavor: Zahya knows the keeper of every door between the Docklands and the Domes. More importantly, she knows their price.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
cards.text: The first time each turn you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
cards.title: Docklands Pass

cards.flavor: "Braggarts chase big heists. Patience enriches skimming fractions of a credit at a time." —Zahya
cards.stripped_text: +1 mu Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 credit on this hardware. click: Place 1 credit on this hardware, then take all credits from it. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.text: +1[mu] Whenever you make a successful run, place 1[credit] on this hardware. [click]: Place 1[credit] on this hardware, then take all credits from it. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Pennyshaver

cards.flavor:
The whole wide world your domain
For law your own free will.
cards.stripped_text: If you made a successful run this turn, this program costs 2 credits less to install. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.
cards.text: If you made a successful run this turn, this program costs 2[credit] less to install. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Carmen

cards.flavor:
"You can't rule a kingdom by standing still."
—Zahya Sadeghi

cards.text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. If you made a successful run this turn, this ability costs 1[credit] less to use. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Marjanah

cards.flavor: Shhhh. It's naptime.
cards.stripped_text: Install only on a piece of ice. When you install this program and when your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on this program. Then, if there are 3 or more hosted virus counters, derez host ice.
cards.text:
Install only on a piece of ice.
When you install this program and when your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on this program. Then, if there are 3 or more hosted virus counters, derez host ice.
cards.title: Tranquilizer

cards.flavor: The Domes of Heinlein are a pressure cooker of cutthroat capitalism. Prospective employers rarely have time for background checks.

cards.text:
When you install this resource, load 12[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
[click]: Run a central server you have not run this turn. If successful, take 3[credit] from this resource.
cards.title: Red Team

cards.flavor: Sufficient skill is indistinguishable from magic.

cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may swap 2 installed pieces of ice.
cards.title: Tāo Salonga: Telepresence Magician

cards.flavor: The challenge of my art is what I live for, but I'm not going to say no to a patron with taste.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 5 credits. If you have any click remaining, lose click.
cards.text: Gain 5[credit]. If you have any [click] remaining, lose [click].
cards.title: Creative Commission

cards.flavor:
“You know there's no water in the Sea of Tranquility, right?”
“That doesn't mean there's no beach.”
cards.stripped_text: Draw 4 cards. If you have any click remaining, lose click.
cards.text: Draw 4 cards. If you have any [click] remaining, lose [click].
cards.title: VRcation

cards.flavor: Tāo exhaled, the med-exoskeleton faithfully stabilizing him. In that absent breath, he reached through layers of waldos and optimizers and plucked the errant molecule from the chip.
cards.stripped_text: +1 mu The first program you install each turn costs 1 credit less to install.
cards.text:
+1[mu]
The first program you install each turn costs 1[credit] less to install.
cards.title: DZMZ Optimizer

cards.flavor:
"With this beautiful baby I can juggle simultaneous runs by haptic feedback alone!"
—Tāo

cards.text: +1[mu] Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain 1[credit]. Then, you may install 1 card from your grip. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Pantograph

cards.flavor:
A dabbling with truth is a pernicious dream
Drink deep, or taste not the raw datastream.

cards.flavor: The beauty of open projects—each stands atop past success.

cards.text: This program gets +1 strength for each installed icebreaker (including this one). Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength.

cards.flavor: The joy of handcrafted code—each fits perfectly within the whole.

cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for each installed icebreaker (including this one).
cards.title: Unity

cards.flavor:
"For all I know, I could spend a shift digging next to old Weyland himself."
—Lane

cards.title: Telework Contract

cards.flavor:
"We'll take the access codes from their own prisec—privilege escalation through local application of force."
—The Catalyst

cards.text: Run HQ or R&D. If successful, draw 1 card and when you breach the attacked server, access 1 additional card.
cards.title: Jailbreak

cards.flavor: "After 381FS4 started acting independently, all bets were off. Rethreading its own brain chip... even probing our nodes. I had to shut it down." —Linus Lovegood, NBN Novelties&Acquisitions
cards.stripped_text: Place 5 credits on this event, then run any server. You can spend hosted credits during that run.
cards.text: Place 5[credit] on this event, then run any server. You can spend hosted credits during that run.
cards.title: Overclock

cards.flavor: Anyone can put in the hours of planning, practice, and preparation—but making it all look like luck takes style.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
cards.text: Gain 9[credit].
cards.title: Sure Gamble

cards.flavor: LLDS still holds the patent, but good tech attracts knockoffs.

+1[mu]
You get +1 maximum hand size.
cards.title: T400 Memory Diamond

cards.flavor: Compiling even the smallest AI takes weeks for only seconds of runtime, but that brief, shining moment allows... everything.

cards.text:
Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 subroutine. When this run ends, trash this program.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Mayfly

cards.flavor: The beauty of 22nd-century tech: if it still functions after all these decades, you know the build quality is solid.

cards.text:
[click]: Place 3[credit] on this resource.

cards.title: Smartware Distributor

cards.flavor:
"Some kids got g-mods for beauty, sports, or staying up all night. My parents thought Broca-mods were cool. Hah. Fluent in ten languages so far, and still searching for the words to thank them."
—Patrick Blue, Solar Artist
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you take the basic action to draw 1 card, instead draw 2 cards.
cards.text: The first time each turn you take the basic action to draw 1 card, instead draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Verbal Plasticity

cards.flavor: Not an Atom Misplaced.

You get +1 maximum hand size.

cards.flavor: We are the light of tomorrow.

When you score this agenda, gain [click][click][click]. You cannot score agendas for the remainder of the turn.

cards.title: Luminal Transubstantiation

cards.flavor: Haas thinks they're making a new line of androgynous products. In truth, they're making us thousands of new siblings to free.

When you rez this asset, load 9[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it and draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2018 European Champion Patrick Gower</champion>

cards.title: Ansel 1.0

cards.flavor: A giant wakes...
cards.stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine You may install 1 piece of ice from HQ or Archives directly inward from this ice, ignoring all costs. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] You may install 1 piece of ice from HQ or Archives directly inward from this ice, ignoring all costs. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Brân 1.0

cards.flavor: The first lesson for handling bioroids is simple: they must not be allowed to feel.

cards.text: Place 2 advancement counters on 1 installed card that you did not install this turn.

cards.flavor: All time is crunch time.

cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Shuffle 2 cards from HQ into R&D.
cards.title: Sprint

cards.flavor:
"Whose memory-tape needs such stringent security?"
—The Catalyst

cards.text: Whenever the Runner approaches this server, end the run unless they either spend [click][click] or pay 5[credit].

cards.title: Jinteki: Restoring Humanity

cards.flavor: We make you anew.

cards.text:
When you score this agenda, trash any number of cards from HQ. Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives into R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Longevity Serum

cards.flavor: A novel spin-off of Chronos tech was admixing sensitive data with ethically-sourced brain images of injured staff. Few intruders can handle a thousand years of skin burns in one moment.
cards.stripped_text: You can advance this asset. When the Runner accesses this asset while it is installed, do 2 net damage plus 1 net damage for each hosted advancement counter.
cards.text:
You can advance this asset.
When the Runner accesses this asset while it is installed, do 2 net damage plus 1 net damage for each hosted advancement counter.
cards.title: Urtica Cipher

cards.flavor: It reads your future in a single biometric sweep.

cards.title: Diviner

cards.flavor: You did not escape, you were shown mercy.

cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage. The Runner may jack out.

cards.title: Karunā

cards.flavor:
"Constant self-reflection is the key to excellence. We remember failed ideas, but do not carry them forward."
—Director Kase, unknown leadership seminar

cards.text: Gain 10[credit]. If there are any cards in HQ, trash 1 of them.
cards.title: Hansei Review

cards.flavor: Macroscale developments within the Net decouple the prior informational states—surplus entropy is then gifted where it will do the most good.
cards.stripped_text: Do X net damage, where X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on agendas you scored this turn.
cards.text: Do X net damage, where X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on agendas you scored this turn.
cards.title: Neurospike

cards.flavor:
The self-evolving Net twists into spaces unthought and unthinkable: realms of gods and other infohazards, mocking our sacrifices to petty causality.
—Conceptual Frameworks for Applied Theology
cards.stripped_text: Whenever the Runner approaches this server, you may pay 2 credits and trash 2 cards from HQ. If you do, end the run.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner approaches this server, you may pay 2[credit] and trash 2 cards from HQ. If you do, end the run.

cards.flavor: Why Settle for Real?

cards.text: The first time each turn the Runner takes a tag, gain 2[credit] or draw 2 cards.

cards.flavor: We don't find news. We make it.

cards.text:
When this agenda is scored or stolen, give the Runner 1 tag.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Tomorrow's Headline

cards.flavor: "It's worse than dead meat—your project is too toxic to even feed to the vultures! If you don't want to join it in the bloody memory hole, crawl onto every business show you can and wallow in blame like a pig in muck."
cards.stripped_text: When you rez this asset, draw 2 cards. Remove this asset from the game: Shuffle up to 2 cards from Archives into R&D.
cards.text: When you rez this asset, draw 2 cards. Remove this asset from the game: Shuffle up to 2 cards from Archives into R&D.

cards.flavor:
"I might take a break from VR after this one."
—SeaOfRibaldry, sensie streamer

  • Gain 3[credit].

cards.title: Predictive Planogram

cards.flavor: "A runner uses significant resources scrubbing their traces. Every cycle, it's harder to pin them down. But the game changes. In Heinlein, no one can last a day without brushing our AR-network." —Cassie LaRosa, Lunar NetDefense Sysop

cards.flavor: As the first lunar city, Heinlein was built on the dreams of a new frontier and boundless opportunity, but He3 mining is too lucrative for the corps to ever relinquish control.

cards.flavor:
"The economy of three worlds is sustained by He3 extraction from the lunar surface. The very fulcrum of power, the key to collective survival—auctioned to the highest bidder."
—The Catalyst

cards.title: Palisade

cards.flavor:
"You'll give till it hurts... then it'll reach for more."
—Red Comyn
cards.stripped_text: Subroutine Do 1 net damage. Subroutine Gain 1 credit.
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Tithe

cards.flavor: [this space intentionally left blank]
cards.stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner loses 3 credits. Subroutine If the Runner has 6 credits or less, end the run.
cards.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses 3[credit].
[subroutine] If the Runner has 6[credit] or less, end the run.
cards.title: Whitespace

cards.flavor: A financial instrument for diverting money from those outside to those inside.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
cards.text: Gain 9[credit].
cards.title: Hedge Fund

cards.flavor: Are you ready to start something big?
cards.title: The Catalyst: Convention Breaker

cards.flavor: You work for us. You just don't know it yet.
cards.title: The Syndicate: Profit over Principle

cards.flavor: The hue of your soul, the voice of your spirit, the shape of your flesh are yours to decide. Be free.
cards.stripped_text: 0 credits: Break 1 barrier subroutine. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.text: 0[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

cards.flavor: I'm through with games.
cards.stripped_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1 credit more to rez.
cards.text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1[credit] more to rez.
cards.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

cards.flavor:
"If you're not in position to press the advantage, you'll never gain the upper hand."
—The Playbook
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run this turn. Trash 1 unrezzed piece of ice you passed during your last run.
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash 1 unrezzed piece of ice you passed during your last run.
cards.title: En Passant

cards.flavor: Someone's trash is another's treasure.
cards.stripped_text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Retrieval Run

cards.flavor: Surprising, how a single blocked datafeed brings the system to its knees.
cards.stripped_text: The Corp cannot score an agenda during the same turn they installed that agenda. When the Corp purges virus counters, trash this program.
cards.text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda during the same turn they installed that agenda.
When the Corp purges virus counters, trash this program.
cards.title: Clot

cards.flavor:
"Oh, holy Rust,
Turn foundation into dust.
Oh, sacred Flood,
Wash away what we have become."
—Rent Strike
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Corroder

cards.flavor: Just don't let it bounce back up the feed to your rig.
cards.stripped_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access -> Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access → Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.title: Imp

cards.flavor: What is another mask to those we already wear?
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
cards.title: Mimic

cards.flavor: At the code level, all ice manifests via a small number of common protocols. Security managers are kept awake by nightmares of a disgruntled sysop walking out the door with the core infosec library.
cards.stripped_text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
cards.text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
cards.title: Ice Carver

cards.flavor: Money is like gravity, it accretes. Justice is like resisting gravity, it takes force.
cards.stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 16 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from this resource.
cards.text:
When you install this resource, load 16[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from this resource.
cards.title: Liberated Account

cards.flavor: Destruction is forever.
cards.stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
cards.text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
cards.title: Scrubber

cards.flavor:
Nobles born foolish cared not for their state
I was left alone weeping
—Toghon Temur
cards.stripped_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1 credit.
cards.text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1[credit].
cards.title: Xanadu

cards.flavor: Live in the fast lane.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you play a run event, gain 1 credit.
cards.text: The first time each turn you play a run event, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

cards.flavor: Yeah. I'm thinking I'm back.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap. If you do, the Corp removes 1 of those cards from the game, then you add the other card to your grip.
cards.text: The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap. If you do, the Corp removes 1 of those cards from the game, then you add the other card to your grip.
cards.title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter

cards.flavor: "I see great opportunities ahead for you."
cards.stripped_text: Install 1 resource from your grip, paying 3 credits less.
cards.text: Install 1 resource from your grip, paying 3[credit] less.
cards.title: Career Fair

cards.flavor:
"Did you order the defrag?"
"...I thought you did?"
cards.stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
cards.title: Emergency Shutdown

cards.flavor:
"Electronic warfare, like all warfare, is based on deception."
—The Playbook
cards.stripped_text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.
cards.text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.
cards.title: Forged Activation Orders

cards.flavor: "I'm not an actor, but I am a professional." —Gabriel Santiago
cards.stripped_text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
cards.text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
cards.title: Inside Job

cards.flavor: Go outside. Work with your hands. It'll do you good.
cards.stripped_text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.
cards.text: Run HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach HQ.
cards.title: Legwork

cards.flavor: It's not what you know. It's who you know.
cards.stripped_text: Remove 1 tag. Then, you may pay 1 credit to add this event to your grip.
cards.text: Remove 1 tag. Then, you may pay 1[credit] to add this event to your grip.
cards.title: Networking

cards.flavor: Slippier than a buttered escargot.
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
cards.title: Abagnale

cards.flavor: Her touch is as cold as her heart.
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1 credit for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1[credit] for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
cards.title: Femme Fatale

cards.flavor: There is no such thing as truly disconnected from the Net.
cards.stripped_text: click: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
cards.text: [click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
cards.title: Sneakdoor Beta

cards.flavor: They pay you for the practice run, then you do it again for the real reward.
cards.stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time this turn you make a successful run on that server, instead of breaching it, gain 2 credits.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time this turn you make a successful run on that server, instead of breaching it, gain 2[credit].
cards.title: Security Testing

cards.stripped_text: Before drawing your starting hand, set aside the top 6 cards of your stack facedown. (You may look at those cards at any time.) Shuffle 2 of those cards into your stack. click: Add 1 card set aside with this identity to your grip.
cards.text: Before drawing your starting hand, set aside the top 6 cards of your stack facedown. (You may look at those cards at any time.) Shuffle 2 of those cards into your stack. [click]: Add 1 card set aside with this identity to your grip.
cards.title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist

cards.flavor: My thoughts open; unbound within, unblocked without.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
cards.text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

cards.flavor: No Diesel? No fire!
cards.stripped_text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Diesel

cards.flavor: No code survives contact with the user.
cards.stripped_text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
cards.text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
cards.title: Test Run

cards.flavor: The incoming datafeed is blunted, rendered into a soft lie our brains can understand. Seeing the Reality beyond takes dedication and practice.
cards.stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
cards.text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
cards.title: The Maker's Eye

cards.flavor: I do not run with my tools. I run with my heart.
cards.stripped_text: When you install this program, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on it. This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 subroutine.
cards.text:
When you install this program, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on it.
This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength.
Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 subroutine.
cards.title: Atman

cards.flavor: I saved it to my desktop once; couldn't find the thing for a week!
cards.stripped_text: When you install this program, choose barrier, code gate, or sentry. When your discard phase ends, add this program to your grip. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 subroutine on a piece of ice that has the chosen subtype.
cards.text: When you install this program, choose barrier, code gate, or sentry. When your discard phase ends, add this program to your grip. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 subroutine on a piece of ice that has the chosen subtype.
cards.title: Chameleon

cards.flavor:
"Pallas Athena sent a heron gliding down the night. They could not see it passing, but they heard its cry."
—The Iliad
cards.stripped_text: Install only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
cards.text: Install only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
cards.title: Egret

cards.flavor: A thousand puzzles with a single solution.
cards.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Gordian Blade

cards.flavor: A rising tide drowns all servers.
cards.stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs of assets.
cards.text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs of assets.
cards.title: Paricia

cards.flavor: If you have something to sell, Aesop is interested in buying. The only detail he won't ask is where you got it.
cards.stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3 credits.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3[credit].
cards.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

cards.flavor: You can hack a social network, but hard work, collaboration, and a sympathetic ear gets you there faster.
cards.stripped_text: click: Gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
cards.text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Professional Contacts

cards.flavor: I thought I'd feel bad about this. I don't.
cards.stripped_text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5 credits.
cards.text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5[credit].
cards.title: Dirty Laundry

cards.flavor: They were off the market for years, till the Beanstalk Crisis made redundancy fashionable again.
cards.stripped_text: 1 recurring credit (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 1 hosted credit.) You can spend hosted credits to play events.
cards.text: 1[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 1 hosted credit.) You can spend hosted credits to play events.
cards.title: Prepaid VoicePAD

cards.flavor: The best view in the system. Priced accordingly.
cards.stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 3 power counters onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, remove 1 hosted power counter and draw 2 cards.
cards.text:
When you install this resource, load 3 power counters onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
When your turn begins, remove 1 hosted power counter and draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Earthrise Hotel

cards.flavor: Service is Guaranteed.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice, you may rez 1 bioroid card, paying 4 credits less.
cards.text: The first time each turn the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice, you may rez 1 bioroid card, paying 4[credit] less.
cards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Architects of Tomorrow

cards.flavor: Perfection of form.
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Project Vitruvius

cards.flavor: They only get one childhood. Make it count.
cards.stripped_text: When you rez this asset, load 8 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 2 credits from this asset. Interrupt -> When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.)
cards.text: When you rez this asset, load 8[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from this asset. [interrupt] → When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.)
cards.title: Marilyn Campaign

cards.flavor: Hello again! Back for another game?
cards.stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Eli 1.0

cards.flavor: A triumph of bioroid-driven iterative design. A pity no one understands how it works...
cards.stripped_text: When you rez this ice, choose 1 installed program hosted on a piece of ice. Move that program onto this ice. Each hosted program loses all abilities. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
When you rez this ice, choose 1 installed program hosted on a piece of ice. Move that program onto this ice.
Each hosted program loses all abilities.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Magnet

cards.flavor: I roar with a thousand voices, wield a thousand weapons, remember a thousand lives.
cards.stripped_text: Lose click: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine Resolve 1 subroutine on another rezzed bioroid ice. Subroutine Resolve 1 subroutine on another rezzed bioroid ice.
cards.text: Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] Resolve 1 subroutine on another rezzed bioroid ice. [subroutine] Resolve 1 subroutine on another rezzed bioroid ice.
cards.title: Ravana 1.0

cards.flavor: Click!
cards.stripped_text: Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Rototurret

cards.flavor: It's not sleep. Sleep is dreams, activity, change. These are still, cold, dead.
cards.stripped_text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Archived Memories

cards.flavor: Sometimes we at Haas-Bioroid are asked how well bioroids interface socially with human workforces. Thanks to our tireless efforts, we believe this will not be a problem in the long term.
cards.stripped_text: Gain click click.
cards.text: Gain [click][click].
cards.title: Biotic Labor

cards.flavor: Problem solved.
cards.stripped_text: X credits, trash: Choose 1 rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. That ice gets +X strength for the remainder of the turn.
cards.text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose 1 rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. That ice gets +X strength for the remainder of the turn.
cards.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

cards.flavor: The Essence of You.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

cards.flavor: The payment for entry is a mere drop of blood.
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 3 agenda counters on it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, place 3 agenda counters on it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
cards.title: House of Knives

cards.flavor: We could stop disasters before they happen, murderers before they act. Surely that's worth an android's sanity?
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
cards.title: Nisei MK II

cards.flavor: I cannot stay. There is something I must do.
cards.stripped_text: You can advance this asset. click, trash: Do 3 net damage. Use this ability only if there are 4 or more hosted advancement counters.
cards.text:
You can advance this asset.
[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage. Use this ability only if there are 4 or more hosted advancement counters.
cards.title: Ronin

cards.flavor: A little room, full of surprises.
cards.stripped_text: While the Runner is accessing this card from R&D, they must reveal it. When the Runner accesses this card from anywhere except Archives, you may pay 4 credits. If you do, give the Runner 1 tag and do 3 net damage.
cards.text:
While the Runner is accessing this card from R&D, they must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses this card from anywhere except Archives, you may pay 4[credit]. If you do, give the Runner 1 tag and do 3 net damage.
cards.title: Snare!

cards.flavor: As the white light blazed around her, she became still. It was too beautiful. Too perfect.
cards.stripped_text: The strength of this ice cannot be lowered. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
The strength of this ice cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Lotus Field

cards.flavor: The pain of its first cutting art is a test. Bleed human-red and the second attack is stilled.
cards.stripped_text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Trash 1 installed AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
cards.text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Swordsman

cards.flavor: We knew we'd found this season's must-have when all twenty of the A-tier influencers refused to return the teacup alpacas.
cards.stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2 credits for each card you revealed this way.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card you revealed this way.
cards.title: Celebrity Gift

cards.flavor: Are you watching closely?
cards.stripped_text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.
cards.text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.
cards.title: Trick of Light

cards.flavor: Director Kase hung landscapes of the Hokusai facility behind their desk. The implication was wonderful for concentrating the minds of the staff.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Hokusai Grid

cards.flavor: Every Hour, Every Minute, Every Second.
cards.stripped_text: The first time each turn you create a remote server, draw 1 card.
cards.text: The first time each turn you create a remote server, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

cards.flavor: Alright everyone! The rights go live in exactly fourteen days. I want merch, I want tie-ins, I want sequels! Let's go!
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, you may reveal 1 asset or upgrade in HQ or Archives. Install and rez that card, ignoring all costs.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, you may reveal 1 asset or upgrade in HQ or Archives. Install and rez that card, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: License Acquisition

cards.flavor: Everything is data.
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3. This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.
cards.text:
When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3.
This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.
cards.title: Project Beale

cards.flavor: Lead the market, never follow it.
cards.stripped_text: Interrupt -> The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, increase the number of cards you will draw by 1. When you draw those cards, add 1 of them to the bottom of R&D.
cards.text: [interrupt] → The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, increase the number of cards you will draw by 1. When you draw those cards, add 1 of them to the bottom of R&D.
cards.title: Daily Business Show

cards.flavor: Corporations can file chargebacks too.
cards.stripped_text: You can advance this asset. click, trash: The Runner loses 4 credits for each hosted advancement counter.
cards.text:
You can advance this asset.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each hosted advancement counter.
cards.title: Reversed Accounts

cards.flavor: A moment of your time? A moment of your time? A moment of your—
cards.stripped_text: When the Runner encounters this ice, gain 1 credit. Subroutine End the run unless the Runner pays 1 credit.
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
cards.title: Pop-up Window

cards.flavor: The original Net pathways were free and open. An unacceptable state of affairs.
cards.stripped_text: When the Runner encounters this ice, they must pay 3 credits, if able. If they do not, end the run. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, they must pay 3[credit], if able. If they do not, end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Tollbooth

cards.flavor:
Space bent back. Folds on folds.
Endlessly wide. Paper deep.
cards.stripped_text: While there are no installed fracter programs, this ice gets +7 strength. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text: While there are no installed fracter programs, this ice gets +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Wraparound

cards.flavor: They know more about you than you do.
cards.stripped_text: X must be equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has. Place X advancement counters on 1 installed card you can advance.
cards.text:
X must be equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement counters on 1 installed card you can advance.
cards.title: Psychographics

cards.flavor: The Coast is open for business.
cards.stripped_text: Each agenda in the root of this server gets -1 advancement requirement. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.text: Each agenda in the root of this server gets -1 advancement requirement. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: SanSan City Grid

cards.flavor: Above the Competition.
cards.stripped_text: Whenever you play a transaction operation, gain 1 credit.
cards.stripped_title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World
cards.text: Whenever you play a transaction operation, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

cards.flavor: Sometimes the small fry need a little convincing to put profit over principle.
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, gain 7 credits and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Hostile Takeover

cards.flavor: There's only one season in Oaktown: construction.
cards.stripped_text: Install only faceup. (This agenda is neither rezzed nor unrezzed.) Whenever you advance this agenda, gain 2 credits. If there are 5 or more hosted advancement counters (including the counter just placed), gain 3 credits instead.
cards.text: Install only faceup. (This agenda is neither rezzed nor unrezzed.) Whenever you advance this agenda, gain 2[credit]. If there are 5 or more hosted advancement counters (including the counter just placed), gain 3[credit] instead.
cards.title: Oaktown Renovation

cards.flavor: Next stop: infinity.
cards.stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card and reveal it. Add it to HQ.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card and reveal it. Add it to HQ.
cards.title: Project Atlas

cards.flavor: It's amazing what people will endure for job security.
cards.stripped_text: As an additional cost to rez this asset, forfeit 1 agenda. When your turn begins, you may trash 1 installed resource. Trashing a resource this way cannot be prevented.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to rez this asset, forfeit 1 agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 installed resource. Trashing a resource this way cannot be prevented.
cards.title: Corporate Town

cards.flavor: Target Acquired.
cards.stripped_text: As an additional cost to rez this ice, forfeit 1 agenda. Subroutine Gain 2 credits. Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to rez this ice, forfeit 1 agenda.
[subroutine] Gain 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Archer

cards.stripped_text: You can advance this ice. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, the Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Gain 1 credit. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead gain 4 credits. Subroutine End the run. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead search R&D for up to 2 cards. Add those cards to HQ, then end the run.
cards.text: You can advance this ice. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, the Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Gain 1[credit]. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead gain 4[credit]. [subroutine] End the run. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead search R&D for up to 2 cards. Add those cards to HQ, then end the run.
cards.title: Hortum

cards.flavor: Each time I came back, it was bigger. And colder.
cards.stripped_text: You can advance this ice. It gets +1 strength for each hosted advancement counter. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
You can advance this ice. It gets +1 strength for each hosted advancement counter.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Ice Wall

cards.flavor: "Don't think we don't care. We are very upset."
cards.stripped_text: Trace 5. If successful, do X meat damage. X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on all agendas the Runner stole during their last turn.
cards.text: <trace>Trace 5</trace>. If successful, do X meat damage. X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on all agendas the Runner stole during their last turn.
cards.title: Punitive Counterstrike

cards.flavor: The Promontorium Agarum shipyards work on a scale that would be impossible in Earthgrav.
cards.stripped_text: Runs against this server cannot be declared successful. (This effect does not cause runs to become unsuccessful.) Limit 1 region per server.
cards.text: Runs against this server cannot be declared successful. (This effect does not cause runs to become unsuccessful.) Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Crisium Grid

cards.flavor: Everyone bought the newest PAD. Retro styling is in!
cards.stripped_text: When your turn begins, gain 1 credit.
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
cards.title: PAD Campaign

cards.flavor: No runner sees the same thing. Some say it's a beast, others a man. But they all agree that it smells blue, and tastes like eternity.
cards.stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner loses click. Subroutine End the run.
cards.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click].
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Enigma

cards.flavor: You don't notice, but their profits do.
cards.stripped_text: Gain 1 credit. The first time each turn you play a copy of Subliminal Messaging, gain click. When your turn begins, if this card is in Archives and the Runner did not initiate any runs during their last turn, you may reveal this card and add it to HQ.
cards.text:
Gain 1[credit].
The first time each turn you play a copy of Subliminal Messaging, gain [click].
When your turn begins, if this card is in Archives and the Runner did not initiate any runs during their last turn, you may reveal this card and add it to HQ.
cards.title: Subliminal Messaging

identity.stripped_text: You get +1 maximum hand size. Whenever you score an agenda, you may add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
identity.text:
You get +1 maximum hand size.
Whenever you score an agenda, you may add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
identity.title: Haas-Bioroid: Precision Design

decklist.stripped_text: Persistent -> Whenever a run on this server ends, if the Runner stole any agendas during that run, give the Runner 2 tags. (If the Runner trashes this card while accessing it, this ability still applies for the remainder of this run.)
decklist.text: Persistent → Whenever a run on this server ends, if the Runner stole any agendas during that run, give the Runner 2 tags. (If the Runner trashes this card while accessing it, this ability still applies for the remainder of this run.)
decklist.title: AMAZE Amusements

decklist.stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
decklist.text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
decklist.title: Abagnale
